Job Title: Escrow Analysis Specialist II

Location: Greenville, SC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Who We Are

Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing (SMS) is one of America’s top-five non-bank mortgage-servicing companies. What is mortgage servicing? Our clients are businesses that own mortgage loans (such as banks and real estate investment firms). On their behalf, we manage (or “service”) their loan portfolios, which means that we collect homeowners’ mortgage payments, pay their tax and insurance bills, and help homeowners in default to get current.

Primary Function

The Escrow Analysis Specialist II will be responsible for running bulk escrow analysis processes and monitor a suite of reports designed to support business operations to minimize risk. The individual will learn and become proficient with Excel and SQL based reports to support the business unit. Additionally, the Escrow Analysis Specialist II will be responsible for completing requests received via group inbox as well as working with the print vendor.

Direct Reports: ☐ Yes ☒ No

N/A

Principal Duties

List of required duties below. 

Perform daily escrow analysis via task work queue, escalation emails, and monthly bulk processing for the portfolio.Research illogical collection amounts, due dates, or large changes in payment to ensure loans are compliant with RESPA regulations.Solves problems rapidly and cost-effectively with minimal disruption.Ensure Tax, Insurance, and PMI lines are set up accurately after loan acquisition.Maintain and develop proficiency in all systems including ILS/IIM/Smartweb/LMS/OnBaseMonitor control reports to meet RESPA and investor timelines.Loan level bankruptcy review; including POC reconciliation and prior servicer information.New loan audits to confirm data points are present for future escrow analyses.Performs related duties as assigned by supervisor.

Education and Experience

Required Education And Experience.

High school diploma or equivalent, required.Bachelor’s degree preferred.2-4 years’ mortgage experience; including escrow analysis.

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities

Required knowledge, skills, and ability.

Proficient with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, and Outlook) including basic Excel formulas.Detail oriented with excellent organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills.Flexible to changing priorities, project scopes, and deadlines at any given time.Must be able to multi-task, respond well under pressure, and work well in a team environment.Knowledge of SQL data warehouse environments and OnBase imaging system; is a plus.Advanced communication (written and verbal) skills with an ability to work well in a collaborative environment with all levels within the organization.

While this description is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position’s requirements, it in no way implies/states that these are the only job responsibilities. Management reserves the right to modify, add or remove duties and request other duties, as necessary. 

By applying to this position candidate acknowledges that this is not a remote role and is required to be on-site.

Company Perks

 15 Paid Time Off (PTO) days and 18 after 1st anniversary! 9 Paid Holidays Employee Engagement Activities

Company Benefits

 Medical (including Health Savings Account & Flexible Savings Account) Dental - RX – Vision – Life, Disability Insurance – 401(k) Plan with company match! – Employee Assistance Plan Performance-based Incentives Pet Insurance Advancement Opportunities

Newrez NOW

 Our Corporate Social Responsibility program, Newrez NOW, empowers employees to become leaders in their communities through a robust program that includes volunteering, philanthropy, nonprofit grants, and more 1 Volunteer Time Off (VTO) day, company-paid volunteer day where all eligible employees may participate in a volunteer event with a nonprofit of their choice Employee Matching Gifts Program: We will match monetary employee donations to eligible non-profit organizations, dollar-for-dollar, up to $1,000 per employee Newrez Grants Program: Newrez hosts a giving portal where we provide employees an abundance of resources to search for an opportunity to donate their time or monetary contributions

Equal Employment Opportunity 

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

CA Privacy Policy

CA Notice at Collection

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
